New Records: Pakistan scored 158/7 in their innings, with Mohammad Rizwan scoring 68 runs at a strike rate of 147.82.
England won the match by 6 wickets with 4 balls remaining.
Phil Salt scored 10 runs off just 12 balls for England, the fastest score by an England batsman in a T20I innings.
Harry Brook hit 42 runs off 25 balls, the second-highest score for England in the match.
Luke Wood was named Player of the Match with 3 wickets for 24 runs.
Key Match Events: England won the match by 6 wickets with 4 balls remaining in the 19.2nd over.
Pakistan collapsed from 150 runs at 18.6 overs to 158/7 in 20 overs.
Mohammad Rizwan and Babar Azam were the top scorers for Pakistan, but their wickets at crucial junctures proved costly.
England's middle-order batting, led by Dawid Malan and Ben Duckett, stabilized the innings after early losses.
The match was a turning point in the series, with England taking a 1-0 lead.
Pre-Game Insights: England won the toss and elected to bat first.
Pakistan's captain Babar Azam was aiming to capitalize on home advantage.
England's key players, including Moeen Ali and Sam Curran, were expected to play pivotal roles in the match.
The match was the T20I debut for Shan Masood.
Post-Match Reflections: England players celebrated the win, with Luke Wood and Phil Salt being praised for their contributions.
Pakistan's players and fans expressed frustration over the collapse in the latter part of the innings.
The match was a crucial moment in England's series, setting the tone for their dominance.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played under clear skies at the National Stadium, Karachi.
The result was England's first win in the series, with Pakistan trailing 0-1.
The match was the 1789th T20I, with Luke Wood making his debut.
Others: The match was part of the England tour of Pakistan in 2022.
The series result after the match was England leading 1-0.
